|brand = LinkSprite |model = Acadia |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = V3.0 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = single-board computer |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = <!-- Federal Communication Commission Identification Number --> |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Freescale (NXP);i.MX6Q;MCIMX6Q5EYM10AD; |cpu1_cores = 4 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex-A9 |cpu1spd = 1.2 GHz <!-- 1.0 / 1.2 GHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = 0 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = DDR3 |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 1 GiB |ram1chip = Micron;MT41K128M16JT-125; |ram1_num = 4 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Atheros;AR8031; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = U-Boot;2009.08;; |stockos = Linux;3.0.35;Ubuntu 12.04;
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0, USB 2.0 (OTG), SATA, Arduino Expansion, MicroSD Card slot |exp_usb_num = 3 |exp_sdmmc_num = 1 |exp_sata_num = 1 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2.5 |pwr_barrel_len = 9.5 |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes,, 3-pin header,, populated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = HDMI 1.4, LVDS, MIPI CSI, Audio out 3.5mm jack, IR receiver, |addchip = USB 2.0 HUB Controller; Genesys Logic;GL850G;;1;,,, Stereo CODEC w/ Audio Enhancement DSP;Wolfson;WM8962;;1;,,, 14 Channel PMIC;Freescale Semiconductor;MMPF0100NPEP;;1;,,, 2.7V 8-Channel 10-Bit A/D Converter;Microchip;MCP3008;;1;,,, HDMI Port Protection and Interface;California Micro;CM2020;;1;,,, Dual-Channel Power Distribution Switch;Micrel;MIC2026-1YM;;2;,,, |802dot11_protocols = none
|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = root |defaultpass = linaro |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = Android 4.4
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 10/2014 |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B017VJ9URG |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ''"pcDuino Acadia 1 V3.0" and "www.pcduino.com"'' are silkscreened near the IR receiver.
===Specifications=== *CPU: ''[[NXP]]'' i.MX6Q ''Quad'' (MCIMX6Q6AVT10C) :@1GHz Quad-Core (ARM Cortex A9) *GPU: ''Vivante'' GC2000 / GC320 :Video decoding 1080p60 H.264 *RAM: 1GB (DDR3) @533MHz *Storage: SATA, MicroSD (TF) Card *Video Output: LVDS and HDMI *Audio Output: Analog via 3.5mm *Network: 1x Gigabit Ethernet *USB: 2x USB 2.0, 1x USB (OTG) *Power: 5V/2A barrel *Dimensions (L x W): 4.72 x 2.56″
==Links of Interest== *[https://www.linksprite.com/wiki/index.php?title=Linksprite_Acadia_3.0 ''Wiki'']
===News=== *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2014/09/23/pcduino-acadia-1-is-a-freescale-i-mx6-quad-development-board-with-arduino-headers/ ''pcDuino Acadia 1 is a Freescale i.MX6 Quad Development Board with Arduino Headers'' on '''CNX|Software'''] *[http://linuxgizmos.com/pcduino-acadia-1-sbc-runs-linux-and-android-on-imx6-quad/ ''pcDuino SBC adopts i.MX6 Quad, loads up on storage'' on '''LinuxGizmos''']
==Pictures== <center>'''Retail Images''' <gallery mode="slideshow"> File:LinkSprite pcDuino Acadia V3 01.jpg| File:LinkSprite pcDuino Acadia V3 02.jpg| </gallery></center>[[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::external| ]]
